bwwExcerpt: The real star of the show is the divine Leslie Rodriguez Kritzer as the Lady of the Lake in what deserves to be a Tony Award-winning turn. (I don’t care that it’s only November!) Channeling a bit of Carol Burnett with a soupcon of Celine Dion, she is both consistently hilarious and vocally spectacular, stealing every spotlight that is shone on her! Indeed, if Broadway could just can this dynamic diva, that would be worth all the Spam in the world.

keyPhrases.quote: what deserves to be a Tony Award-winning turn
she is both consistently hilarious and vocally spectacular, stealing every spotlight
that would be worth all the Spam in the world

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: Effusive praise with superlatives ('divine', 'Tony Award-winning', 'vocally spectacular') and strong endorsement that seeing the show would be 'worth it' for this performance alone indicates a rave recommendation. | GPT-4o-mini: The review expresses unqualified enthusiasm for Leslie Rodriguez Kritzer's performance, indicating a strong recommendation to see the show.
